annotations.description: An example application based on RH-SSO 7.6 on OpenJDK image. For more information about using this template, see https://github.com/jboss-container-images/redhat-sso-7-openshift-image/tree/sso76-dev/docs.
annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6 on OpenJDK (Ephemeral with passthrough TLS)
annotations.template.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed to develop Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.6 on OpenJDK server based deployment, securing RH-SSO communication using passthrough TLS. It is intended to be used solely on OpenShift 4.X versions. For OpenShift 3.X variant of this template refer to the 'sso76-ocp3-https' one.

message: A new RH-SSO service has been created in your project. The admin username/password for accessing the master realm via the RH-SSO console is ${SSO_ADMIN_USERNAME}/${SSO_ADMIN_PASSWORD}. Please be sure to create the following secrets: "${HTTPS_SECRET}" containing the ${HTTPS_KEYSTORE} file used for serving secure content; "${JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_SECRET}" containing the ${JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_KEYSTORE} file used for securing JGroups communications; "${SSO_TRUSTSTORE_SECRET}" containing the ${SSO_TRUSTSTORE} file used for securing RH-SSO requests. To enable also dual-network clusters that support both IPv4 and IPv6 address families, all services defined by this template are configured having the 'spec.ipFamilyPolicy' field set to 'PreferDualStack' by default.

annotations.description: The JGroups ping port for clustering.

parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME
parameters.description: The name for the application.

parameters.name: HOSTNAME_HTTP
parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>.<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: HOSTNAME_HTTPS
parameters.description: Custom hostname for https service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>.<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: SSO_HOSTNAME
parameters.description: Custom hostname for the RH-SSO server.

parameters.name: HTTPS_SECRET
parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file

parameters.name: HTTPS_KEYSTORE
parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret

parameters.name: HTTPS_KEYSTORE_TYPE
parameters.description: The type of the keystore file (JKS or JCEKS)

parameters.name: HTTPS_NAME
parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate (e.g. jboss)

parameters.name: HTTPS_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate (e.g. mykeystorepass)

parameters.name: DB_MIN_POOL_SIZE
parameters.description: Sets xa-pool/min-pool-size for the configured datasource.

parameters.name: DB_MAX_POOL_SIZE
parameters.description: Sets xa-pool/max-pool-size for the configured datasource.

parameters.name: DB_TX_ISOLATION
parameters.description: Sets transaction-isolation for the configured datasource.

parameters.name: JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_SECRET
parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file

parameters.name: JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_KEYSTORE
parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret

parameters.name: JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_NAME
parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate (e.g. secret-key)

parameters.name: JGROUPS_ENCRYPT_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate (e.g. password)

parameters.name: JGROUPS_CLUSTER_PASSWORD
parameters.description: JGroups cluster password

parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE
parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat Middleware images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You should only need to modify this if you've installed the ImageStreams in a different namespace/project.

parameters.name: SSO_ADMIN_USERNAME
parameters.description: RH-SSO Server administrator username

parameters.name: SSO_ADMIN_PASSWORD
parameters.description: RH-SSO Server administrator password

parameters.name: SSO_REALM
parameters.description: Realm to be created in the RH-SSO server (e.g. demorealm).

parameters.name: SSO_SERVICE_USERNAME
parameters.description: The username used to access the RH-SSO service. This is used by clients to create the appliction client(s) within the specified RH-SSO realm.

parameters.name: SSO_SERVICE_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the RH-SSO service user.

parameters.name: SSO_TRUSTSTORE
parameters.description: The name of the truststore file within the secret (e.g. truststore.jks)

parameters.name: SSO_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the truststore and certificate (e.g. mykeystorepass)

parameters.name: SSO_TRUSTSTORE_SECRET
parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the truststore file (e.g. truststore-secret). Used for volume secretName

parameters.name: MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Container memory limit.
